comms: Not included in the database because X is expressed as an NP-internal modifier.
sentence: Sara-s dana-s ge ra tsû
comms_internal: A slightly less natural alternative is as follows: “Sara-s ge tsûadana-b-a  ūhâ” [S.-3F.SG DECL headache-3M.SG-OBL have] ‘Sara has a headache’. This does not meet the includion criteria either, because Y is expressed as part of a nominal compound. All body part are the same: you get these compounds, the alternative is to have X as a possessor.

sentence: Petru-b ge Maria-s ǃoagu sunu-b-a ūhâ
glosses_en: PN-3M.SG DECL PN-3F.SG-OBL opposite grudge-3M.SG-OBL have
comms_internal: CV. ǃoa is a complex postposition meaning ‘opposite, against’ , it derives from ǃoa ‘to, in the direction of, facing’ + REFL. Other examples I have with it are in expressions such as “That will come against her”, “we should forgive people who do wrong to (against) us”, “there would have to be harm to you”.
